Trails.Name: Lost in the Woods (Lower) Uphill Route
Lost in the Woods (Upper) Uphill Route

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Friday, February 20, 2026 11:30 AM We currently have 16 lifts open, conditions permitting. See below for more information. Expect rolling openings limited to lower-mountain lifts only. 17 lifts are expected to spin today out of all base lodges, with delays likely due to avalanche mitigation. The storm cleared overnight after delivering 6394 inches of powder over the past four days, leaving the mountain quiet and cold under a deep new blanket of snow. We appreciate your patience and understanding as our teams work to dig out and safely open more terrain as conditions allow.  

Upcoming Storm Cycle Expectations: Upper-mountain lifts are not expected to turn today. Please review our updated storm cycle procedure, new this year.    
Conditions: Bitterly cold temperatures starting in the single digits this morning. Clear skies and light winds today.  
Visibility: We are out of low visibility conditions, so dig out that dark lens today.  
Lift status: We currently have 16 lifts open, conditions permitting. Patrol will focus on getting lower mountain lifts open first. 17 total lifts are expected, conditions permitting. We appreciate your patience as our team works our way around the mountain to assess conditions. 
Open lifts: Broadway Express (1), Stump Alley (2), Roller Coaster Express (4), Unbound Express (6), Chair 7, Chair 8, Gold Rush Express (10), Discovery Express (11), Eagle Express (15), Canyon Express (16), Schoolyard Express (17), Chair 20, Chair 21, Chair 25, the Lower Panorama Gondola, and the Village Gondola.
Lifts that will be delayed for mitigation work: Chair 22.
Safety: Deep snow remains a serious factor. The risk of Snow Immersion Suffocation (SIS) is real, so avoid tree wells and deep snow near trees. Always ski or ride with a partner, keep your group in sight, and stay alert for obstacles beneath new snowfall. Visit our Safety page for more tips. Our on-mountain emergency hotline is: 760.934.0611
Road Conditions: Chains or snow tires are currently required. Roads are currently snowy and icy. If driving, please drive with caution and allow extra space. Check our Road Conditions page for the latest status on highway closures, especially if you are traveling from out of town.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport:
Deep Snow Safety: Stay within sight of your group, give trees plenty of space, and avoid riding solo. Obstacles may exist beneath new snow, so ski and ride with caution.
On-mountain emergency hotline: 760.934.0611
